subject: In Poznan
event:
A long day of travel yesterday, but we're in Poznan now, on the third stop of my Polish tour.  Big booksigning tonight.  Tunrout may rival Warsaw.

Ty is almost himself again, though seriously sleep deprived.  He slept all the way from Nidzica to Poznan.  My own sleep cycle remains screwy.  I am wide awake right now, at six in the morning, but I tend to fade badly in late afternoon/ early evening.  I will need to break that cycle today, or I'll sleep through my booksigning.

It felt strange not to watch GAME OF THRONES last night.  Reports of the season finale seem good, however, so I am encouraged.

My biggest problem continues to be all the tech that I brought with me to keep me connected with the world.  Supposedly everything was fixed and set with my cell phone and its Polish sim... but no,  it would still not connect back to Santa Fe.  I made a call with the hotel land line instead, but failed to reach Parris.  Left a message instead.  I HOPE it was on my home machine, but you never know.  And my laptop functions well enough for accessing the internet, but cannot find the server that allows it to connect to my home machine and georgerrmartin.com -- which means I have NO access to any email, and haven't had for days.  This is stressing me considerably.  What with everything going on in my life and career right now, it is really not good for me to be so cut off.  I was repeatedly told that getting off AOL would make things better for me, email wise, but so far this seems not to be the case.  AOL can at least be accessed from anywhere in the world.  So I just hope no one from Random House, HarperCollins, HBO, or any of my other associates is trying to get hold of me for some urgent matter... if you are, alas, nothing is getting through.  All I can say, well, Ty is Working On It.

comments.article:
You might consider seeing if you have have email forwarded as a copy to a secondary address - such as a google mail address, which seems to have good connections most places as well?

It might alleviate some of the stress of not being able to connect to your home network.

Otherwise, I do hope you're enjoying the rest of your trip. Sad that technology isn't holding up it's end of the existential agreement in keeping you connected and up to date!

I think it should be better when you reach Slovenia. I don't know why exactly you're experiencing those problems, but I have no problems reaching America on my cell phone. If nothing else, I'm sure you can find someone to help you call home. And have you tried using Skype?

comments.article:
Respectfully, getting off AOL's Jurassic internet service is a great idea; getting off AOL's largely stable email system to switch to a dedicated server is a wretched, terrible idea for exactly the reasons you describe. I realize this may not be much help until you get back from Poland, but unless you have NSA-level privacy concerns I would recommend returning to cloud-based email - GMail is unequivocally the best and easiest to get set up, although Yahoo and Hotmail are perfectly fine. Sounds like your webmaster either has a vested interest in getting you to switch to and stay on those servers or has (as IT folks sometimes do) hitched his wagon to a technology he likes and is blinded to its limitations.

Anyway, if you're interested, the season finale was stellar, book sales are sure to go up, and you're finally done with "A Dance With Dragons." Hope you enjoy the rest of your time abroad.
The finale was tremendous, George and wait until you get to the final scene.  Beyond my expectations, truly.
btw - SEason was awesome...

As far as I know using 'mail2web.com' connects to whatever server you use anywhere in the world. I've used it in the UK, France, Sweden, Finland and last week in Turkey. It may be slowish and somewhat cumbersome but you CAN always access your e-mail.
Good luck,
Charles

comments.article: Ty is working on it.  There's nothing you can do but give up and enjoy the disconnect. The season finale was FANTASTIC!  Everyone is pleased.  My husband and I are thrilled about the wonderful anniversary gift we'll both be receiving on July 12th.  You have done very well!!  And your fans are proud of you!  Now, enjoy your trip.

I was browsing the Chapters/Indigo bookstore online, and saw that the latest book is supposed to be available for pre-order (can't wait for that!), and after following a few links found my way here.

Just wanted to say that the season finale was amazing. I started reading a Song of Ice and Fire a couple years ago, and I quite seriously think that the new HBO adaptation is the *single* best adaptation I've ever seen. I was a huge fan of Tolkien, and when they moved those works onto the screen, I thought that was probably as good as we were likely to see. Boy, I was wrong.

This has stayed incredibly close to the book. A better cast couldn't have been asked for, and just... everything about it is so true to the books, it's amazing. I seriously can not wait for the next season! I'll be making a point to get it all on DVD / BluRay for my collection as soon as it's available!

Thank you so much, for everything!
comments.subject: Great Season Finale!

George, when you set up a new mail account, make sure you use IMAP protocol and this way you will be able to check your email on any machine (phone, tablet, pc) and have it all synchronized beautifully without any problems. For example I can check and replay to my emails on the phone while traveling by train and when I reach home it will be all on my computer without me doing anything.

As far as the season finale is concerned it will be aired today on Polish HBO so you may still have a chance to watch it in the hotel.

Hi George,

As someone already mentioned, your best bet is to set-up a gmail account and then set up mail forwarding.

I'm sure with a combination of:

Setting up a gmail account
Giving the host a call via skype to get the mail settings (your home mail host)
Setting up the forwarding in gmail

You should be able to access you emails and respond to them as well all through gmail - I've set that up myself for my work emails and it works perfectly.

Hope this helps, good luck!

Tom
